description_en: The key for the entrance's door.
A bunch of fuses of different voltage.
They key to all the rooms.

February 17th, 1765.

The house is finally built. We'll start moving in shortly.
After many years, the appropriate conditions appear again. What a better way to inagurate the new house with the start of the boaluahe.
I don't know what will happen. The effects may take many years to appear. But it's the time.

Iabes El, niis odzamran zomdv Alonusahi. Ome boaluahe.

July 24th, 1797.

My father recently passed away. He was the starter of the rituals of the boaluahe. He died ecstatic. We have never seen him like that.
For many years he has trained me to continue with the rituals. The effects are not yet present, but our gono keeps strong.

My child shows signs to be able to start participating in the rituals. I'll train him the same way my father trained me, and my child will train his child the same way I will train him.

Iabes El, niis odzamran zomdv Alonusahi. Ome boaluahe.

November 3rd, 1847.

I'm alone. No family left. But I must have a family to continue the rituals. Why did my parents die so young? I thought the rituals should help. Did my ancestors do something wrong?
I need to perpetuate my lineage. I must find a husband. I must procreate.

Iabes El, niis odzamran zomdv Alonusahi. Ome boaluahe.

June 6th, 1963.

Every generation dies earlier. The first ancestor lived past his 60s. My mother lived only until her late 20s. There's not much time for me left.
Why? Why!? The rituals should've helped prolong life. Iabes El, weren't we faithful? Didn't we worship you enough?

It's time for the last ritual. I won't be able to have children before I die. Preparations are ready. I only have to wait until the 4th void moon.

Iabes El, niis odzamran zomdv Alonusahi. Ome boaluahe.

First flew the white Pelican,
eager for the reward.

Then came a silent Dove,
flying beyond the Pelican,
as far as he could.

A Raven flies in,
flying higher and in front than the Dove.

A Swan glides in to find a peaceful spot
next to another bird.

Finally, out comes a Crow,
coming quickly to a stop,
yawning and then napping.

First ritual
	On the 1st full moon of the 4th month. 1765.
	Par biab a acaro. Bogira vaoresa ome. Niis, Iabes El!

Last ritual
	On the 4th void moon of the 6th month. 1963.
	Tol niis adagita a uls. Par biab a uls. Iabes El saba apila paaotza.

This is the first note.
And this is the second line.
This is the key item's description.
